metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5766 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the _gd2GetHeader function in gd_gd2.c in the GDGraphics Library (aka libgd) before 2.2.3, as used in PHP before 5.5.37,5.6.x before 5.6.23, and 7.x before 7.0.8, allows remote attackers to causea denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow and application crash) orpossibly have unspecified other impact via crafted chunk dimensions in animage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5766` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.1.0-3ubuntu0.2
libgd3 - 2.1.0-3ubuntu0.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-3ubuntu0.2').
